intro: Pimpinella hookeri var. graminifolia, commonly known as the slender cowparsley, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has finely divided, grass-like leaves that give it its varietal name. Its small white flowers appear in spring, and it produces small, smooth seeds that are dispersed by wind. The plant is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
